name: Dynamic Price Change for WooCommerce
author: Codept Solutions

sections.description:
Create a Fear of Missing out with your WooCommerce products and start getting more sales by providing a nice countdown to when your prices change.

With this plugin you can set of times when the prices of the product will rise or drop. The product price will change into the price that youâ€™ve defined.

There will be a countdown displayed. This countdown will then build up scarcity so that your customers can’t resist into buying your product

Perfect when launching your next WooCommerce product!

Features:
– Seamless integration into WooCommerce via its hooks
– Choose between price rise or drop
– Set price increment / decrement
– Fixed value price rise or drop
– Set minimal / maximal price
– Show counter for next price drop / raise on single product page
– Set drop / rise price timeframe – price will change from time to time and stop

WooCommerce 3.0 is requested. It won’t work on version below 3.0.
sections.installation:
1. Install using the WordPress built-in Plugin installer, or Extract the zip file and drop the contents in the wp-content/plugins/ directory of your WordPress installation.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

sections.faq:
How can I call countdown timer on home page or other page?

You can use [dpcw_show_counter product_id product_id=xx] shortcode in your page templete for display counter. Here you need to add the product id in the shortcode.

Does this plugin work with caching plugins?

Yes, but we suggest you to turn off cache on single page products where you have drop price enabled. All of our plugins have same requirements for caching as WooCommerce – check it here https://docs.woocommerce.com/document/configuring-caching-plugins

Will the original price remain?

Yes, We make changes directly on the product regular price. But when you deactivate the plugin, There are option for revert original price of the product.

Where can I ask for help?

Please reach out via the official support forum on WordPress.org.
